chunks.en: I encountered some problems during my commute to work. I'm asking for help from all V2EX users.

I encountered some issues during my commute to work:

I'm asking on behalf of a female friend. She occasionally works night shifts a few days a week, finishing work around **12 AM** and living about **8 kilometers from home.**
In this situation, if she takes a taxi, what's the most economical way? Are there any recommended discount coupons or similar options?
But the most important thing is **safety**: Among ride-hailing services like Didi and Huaxiaozhu, which is safer (she's very concerned about this)?
I suggested she find a new job. But V2EX users, besides that suggestion, do you have any other useful advice? Thank you.
My suggestion: You should find a job in her city, solving two major problems.
She just wants you to work in her city, and you're thinking about solving problems?
8 kilometers, get a small electric scooter, it'll take at most 20 minutes at night.

You can call her every time she gets in the car, ask if she's in the car, then tell her you're waiting downstairs for her. When she's almost home, call again and say you're downstairs. Tell her to turn up the volume on her phone's earpiece so the driver can hear, so the driver basically won't have any wrong idea.

Before my wife met me, she lived in Shunyi and worked in Wangjing. Due to her job, she would get off work at 9 or 10 PM. At that time, she either took the subway (it didn't run as late as 12 AM, but there was still subway service), or took a premium car service, which was Shenzhou at the time. It feels like it's difficult to have both safety and affordability. I think premium car services are definitely safer.
However, premium car services are expensive, so then take a taxi. After all, full-time professional drivers are also screened by the taxi company. Considering using coupons can be done after this.
